intro: Trichotosia hallieri, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silvery foliage and daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils and coastal conditions. It has small, narrow leaves covered in fine white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Trichotosia hallieri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
